content.description: Sit start with some nice textured rails and crimps  Pull onto the wall and reach up slowly to a right hand pinch with a crystal thumb catch. From here surf out to a mega-wide left-hand pinch before continuing up using a gaston in the crack. Once here figure out which crystals you want to grab and grab the bucket at the lip!
content.protection: 3 pads. Landing is a bit scary. A spotter is recommended!
content.location: The center of the downhill face!

content.description: Sit start with right hand on the arete and left hand doing nothing. Find a left foot outside edge smear and a right heelhook around the arete. Pull on and core up to a small crimper left of the arete. Snag this then make a right hand move to a giant shelf. Match hands then figure out how you are going to get to the lip. A huge lock-off, a big deadpoint, or mantel the shelf!
content.protection: 2 or 3 pads. Landing is pretty terrifying!
content.location:
On the Elemental Boulder. This problem is on the down hill side of the block and has the rock slab landing. You can't miss the shelf at around 6 feet. 

  From the Lone Wolf Boulder look left and this is the large cube like block.

content.description: Stand start on a couple good sidepulls on the arete. Pull on and lockoff to a decent lefthand shelf, then come in right hand to a poor right hand crimp/ sloper. Campus up a foot and cross up to a mini pinch above your head. Roll into it and bump to a jug on the lip! a thriller with a sketchy landing, lots of body tension and fun movement!
content.location: The proud vertical arete just left of "Fire". This boulder problem has a large flat rock under it that teeters from side to side.

content.description: A fun traverse starting on "Earth" and topping out as for "Fire". Pull on to "Earth and traverse the lip into "Wind", where you can get a nice rest for the crux section. Traverse the lip a few more times then drop down to some crimps. Make it through the crimp section to gain increasingly better slopers and eventually jugs. Go around the "Water" arete and traverse a few more moves then topout!

This fun arete is full value, sit start, uses the arete and the crack on the face, interesting moves and a good topout to finish.  

  Sit start under the mini overhang/bulge with both hands in the crack. Figure out how to get off the ground (kinda tricky), make a hard slap to a sloper crimp around the bulge, grab the arete and a perfect edge, then figure out how to get up to the top using the crack out left and the arete, make a crux high bump on the arete then power to the lip, it's a flat jug.
content.location: On the 4 Elements Boulder, if you're looking at Lone Wolf look to the left, this is the square boulder about 60ft away. This is the arete you'll see on the right.

content.description: Stand start beneath the arete. Place the right foot on the starting block and stand up to some good holds on the arete. From here waste energy trying to figure out where you want your feet or just go with the flow and campus the arete on good holds. You can pretty much mantel anywhere.
content.location: This is the arete on the far side of the Elemental Boulder.

content.description: This is a large square cut boulder standing on the hillside. The boulder has four nice arete problems on it, "Earth" being the easiest of the four, and "Water" being the hardest and most technical arete on the boulder, followed closely by slopey yet crystally arete named "Fire".
